structure.unit: SOVEREIGNTY AND JURISDICTION OF THE COMMONWEALTH
GRANTS TO UNITED STATES OF LANDS AND RIGHTS TO ACQUIRE

law.catch_line: Jurisdiction over military post (Fort Knox) at West Point ceded.
law.text: Kentucky cedes to the United States all the rights and jurisdiction which she now possesses over the land and premises in the vicinity of West Point, Kentucky, conveyed or to be conveyed to the United States for the purpose of establishing a permanent camp of instruction and military post, so long as the same shall remain the property of the United States.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2376d-1.
